text: It's been 19 years now since the tragedy of 9/11. But this is the first time I have spoken to a child of a 9/11 victim. Matthew Bocchi's father worked in the North Tower of the World Trade Center, and Matt was just 9 years old when the attack happened. He says watching and re-watching the footage from that fateful day left "an everlasting mark" that led him to a dark place. However, as he details in his new book, "Sway," he found a new passion and purpose for his life. And he also has a message for a very divided America: It's time to bring back the resilience our nation showed after 9/11 and become one again.
